_description: A fragmentary text of Cato’s Distichs, corresponding to I.20-II.5 of the original Latin text, consisting of the Latin of each distich, followed by the Anglo-Norman text and the Middle English — 32 six-line stanzas

BodEngmiscc291.First Lines:
If þi pore frendeGif þe with loueli
                    hend…
BodEngmiscc291.Last Lines:
…Þat in pes wil lifeAls þing askis &
                    tyme
BodEngmiscc291.Editions:
Horrall,  Sarah M. 
             “An Unknown Middle English Translation of the Distichs of Cato.” 
             Anglia
         99 (1981): 25-37: 30-6.
